Reviews.Title: Cheaper and better than the Nikon LF-1
Reviews.Author: Shane O. Laake "camera nerd"
Reviews.Content: Nikon quietly replaced the LF-1 with this cap, the LF-4.  Nothing Earth shattering, but the new cap is easier to grip and has a larger flange to press against the lens' mount as well as any weather sealing.  Both are nice improvements, and like the LF-1 (and unlike many knock-offs), this cap easily and securely mounts no matter how rotated.  So cheaper, better (just barely), and likely soon all that will be, that's what you get.  Perhaps the lower cost is due to the LF-1 being made in Japan while this is made in Thailand, but since Nikon sees fit to make millions of DSLRs and lenses in Thailand (not to mention that Japan has lots of other stuff to worry about), that's not so much as issue as an observation.

Reviews.Title: Better Seal, Easier "On/Off's"
Reviews.Author: D. Baumwald
Reviews.Content: After I purchased the relatively new 55-300mm lens, I noticed that it shipped with a different rear cap than any other lens I have purchased.  This was the LF-4 cap.  After making note of this, I began paying attention to the practical differences between the LF-4 and the original LF-1.First, the LF-4 is much easier to grip than the LF-1.  The two differences are the thicker and longer ribs and the matted finish of the plastic on the exterior.  Both of these combine for easier "on-and-off's" during lens changes, especially if your hands are somewhat damp, for whatever reason.Secondly, the LF-4 has a flange that increases the coverage for the rear of the lens body.  This certainly seems to provide more of a weather-tight seal, exposing less aluminum to the environment.  As for the precision of the fit between the lens and the LF-4, this seems equal to the LF-1.  However, with the improved grip, it is possible to tighten it down more to the lens body, especially since removal is easier.One more thing.  To me, the LF-4 seems like it would have more "give" during an impact than the original LF-1, due to the type of plastic used for its construction. This is strictly opinion based on feel alone, and it may be an illusion only.After using both caps for some time, on various lenses, I believe I will be replacing all of my LF-1's with the newer LF-4's.  This cap may not be for everyone, or every lens for that matter.  However, for me, the added "sense" of security is enough to make the switch.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4: New evolutionary essential for every Nikkor Lens
Reviews.Author: John Williamson
Reviews.Content: As camera owners, we all go crazy at times, finding ways to protect the front element of our lenses by purchasing filters, lens cleaners, lens hoods and such. Yet what is forgotten so often is that it's the crucial rear lens element that the light passes through just before it reaches the sensors on our cameras.If you own a Nikon DSLR, regardless of which model it is, then the Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap should be considered as an essential for good lens storage and protection. These are made from hard plastic, and they will protect that critical rear element on your Nikkor lens from smudges, scratches and dust. This is the right rear lens cap for all Nikkor lenses for DSLRs and will fit almost every Nikon F-mount lens ever made, and that also includes teleconverters.The first time that I attended the old traveling Nikon School in the '70s, one of the instructors was the late Sterling Clark, who was not only teaching the course, but was an avid Nikon 35 mm shooter with a background in sports photojournalism. He carefully explained why it was essential to protect the rear element more than the front by showing 35mm slides (back in the day), showing first slides with a big thumbprint on the front of the lens and the same on the rear. Next came identical images shot with Kodachrome, with the results. It was clear to all that the often overlooked rear element was the one that needed to be protected the most.So what's the difference between Nikon's LF-1 Rear Lens Cap and the new LF-4 Rear Lens Cap? Not much, according to Nikon. The LF-4 is a newer version with a slightly different and easier to grip design. Call it product evolution.The Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap costs less than a low-end filter, so the investment to protect the back element from debris is quite reasonable. In this age of where 'new and improved' products often cost more then their predecessors, it's good to see that this new  LF-4 Rear Lens Cap actually costs less than the one that it has replaced.9/20/2012

Reviews.Title: Fits my Nikon Lens Perfectly!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Ojeda "Jessica Ojeda"
Reviews.Content: I like the matte black finish and how the cap twists on and sort of "locks" in place. I feel safe knowing that my lens is protected by this Nikon L4-4 Rear Lens Cap. :)Pros:1) fits snug2) looks niceCons:1) that it didn't come with my lens instead of a pop-on milky white plastic rear lens cap!

Reviews.Title: It's a lens cap, nuff said
Reviews.Author: Daniel Harley
Reviews.Content: It's a lens cap, it fits properly and is as described.  Not much else can be said about this.  Very happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: New style rear cover
Reviews.Author: Jumbonas
Reviews.Content: This is the new style rear cover. works as well as the old ones. Slightly different nylon, but seems pretty solid. Expensive for a little molded piece of plastic.

Reviews.Title: Works much better than previous model caps!
Reviews.Author: Kevin & Samantha
Reviews.Content: This cap works very well - a lot better than the previous model caps (which shipped with older lenses such as the D90 kit lenses, the 35mm/1.8 DX, etc.). In fact, it may be working too well because if you have a manly (strong) hand with a lot of strength, you can actually tighten these caps onto the lens so that it will require quite a bit of effort to take them back off!

Reviews.Title: It is genuine
Reviews.Author: Velo Traveller "Jim"
Reviews.Content: The person who wrote the ad copy for this product should have made it clear that this lens cap is actually a new, genuine, made-by-Nikon product in genuine NIkon packaging.The cap works perfectly; nice and tight.Genuine parts at a great price.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Dean Lester
Reviews.Content: As a professional with many lenses, its great to be able to protect the workings of the connecting end of a lens so easily

Reviews.Title: Fits
Reviews.Author: Stephen the Monk
Reviews.Content: It's a rear lens cap for a Nikon camera, it fits my Nikkor 50MM Prime lens perfectly. What else can you say other than it's cheap protection if you're missing one?

Reviews.Title: It is the original from Nikon
Reviews.Author: G. Carlo Tarantino
Reviews.Content: It the original cap from Nikon. Check Nikon web site to verify if it is the right one for your lens.It works as it should and tolerances are way better than what you get from imitations.

Reviews.Title: Fits and works great
Reviews.Author: Andrew Beyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my Nikon D3000 and it fits fine. I have had no issues with it falling off.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: D.S. Ranger
Reviews.Content: Simple lens cap that functions as advertised.  Excellent fit and finish ensures cap securely and effectively protects lens.  Another quality product from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Brittany R Bekas
Reviews.Content: I seem to misplace this little guys, so I was happy to pick up another one to protect my lens. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Better than the LF-1?
Reviews.Author: Arved G. Grass
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be an update to the old, traditional LF-1 rear lens cap. I'm not sure what happened to the LF-2 and LF-3. Yes, this is different, but no, I'm not sure it's any better. Some like it, but I think I prefer the original LF-1. Maybe it's a new generation thing. I've been using Nikons since the old FA film camera of 1984. Read the other reviews. Maybe it is better on some of the lenses it was introduced with, but all my lenses (including 3rd party lenses) work just fine with the "old" LF-1.

Reviews.Title: Nikon quality
Reviews.Author: Panya
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say about the cap. Very well-made. Doesn't feel cheap. Another quality product from Nikon. I was missing a cap for my kit lens because I use the rear lens cap from my prime lens for it. Now I have rear caps for both my lenses.

Reviews.Title: Much needed caps.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Some caps fit funny on old F-mount lenses. These caps have that nice tight fit you want. You'll never worry about these slipping off.

Reviews.Title: Fit perfect
Reviews.Author: None
Reviews.Content: I lost my rear lens cap and this one fits perfectly on my nikon dx 18-50, exactly as described. thank you

Reviews.Title: Its a real Nikon lens cap.
Reviews.Author: Bill Taylor
Reviews.Content: This is the latest Nikon design; no clue why they changed it.  Older design (LF-1) is still available and cheaper.  It's a lens cap.Is either Nikon design any better than much cheaper, third-party, non-Nikon caps as far a protecting the lens? Probably not much, though the plastic used in the Nikon caps seems to be less brittle than some third-party caps, so they seem to fasten slightly more securely.Still there's something that inspires confidence when used equipment comes on the market with original Nikon caps.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit on lens.
Reviews.Author: Roberto S.
Reviews.Content: Bought a new Nikon 18-55 II and it came with an ugly white plastic cap. Now it has this nice cap.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: C. R. Martin "Renaisance Man"
Reviews.Content: fit, as expected.Ya gotta love the consistency of both Amazon and Nikon. Makes perfect sense to purchase Nikon equipment from an organization like Amazon. When I buy my photo gear ( always Nikon) I know that (for the most part) the really important pieces are going to be interchangeable amongst my existing camera bodies and accessories. That's consistency.I also know that when I place an order, particularly a Prime order, with Amazon, what I receive is exactly what I ordered, exactly when I expected it - that's consistency.

Reviews.Title: it is what it is
Reviews.Author: CW. Scogin
Reviews.Content: quality nikon rear lens cap made of thick black plastic perfectly fits my nikkor FX lens. exactly what I expected at B&H; prices.

Reviews.Title: It's a Nikon brand product
Reviews.Author: Susan Carter
Reviews.Content: It's a Nikon brand lens cap. It fits my lens just right. I think it's a good idea for each lens to have its own cap.

Reviews.Title: Good Ole Nikon
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Just an ole Nikon Rear Lens Cap. Made my Good Trusted Nikon and get any more simple than that :) lol

Reviews.Title: Fits better than the original
Reviews.Author: AdventurerWA
Reviews.Content: I got this after losing one of my original lens caps. This fits better than the original for some reason,

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Guadalupe Barba Jr.
Reviews.Content: Bought these for a couple of lenses I have laying around with no caps. They fit perfectly, with no issues.  The caps feel solid and high quality.

Reviews.Title: Cheap unbranded alternative rear cap
Reviews.Author: burningmind06
Reviews.Content: Not a whole lot to say here.  It fits fine and appears to not be really cheap.  I would buy this again if I needed another one.

Reviews.Title: I always seem to run short of rear lens caps
Reviews.Author: rthompson "Rob Thompson"
Reviews.Content: Having different lenses from different manufacturers means you get generic lens caps both front and rear.  They never seem to satisfy me.  These have worked well with all brands of lens and give me that little extra confidence that they are going to stay put.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: CameraLady
Reviews.Content: This little do-hickey serves its purpose extremely well. It fits, protects, and is worth the price paid. I highly recommend the seller and the item.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit - quite inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Skitty
Reviews.Content: I lose these regularly so just bought a bunch. They are every bit as snug and solid as the OEM

Reviews.Title: Fits like it should
Reviews.Author: A. Panossian
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace the rear cap that went missing on my Nikon lens.  It fits as it should, and I am no longer worried about damaging the rear lens element.

Reviews.Title: Just like an original!
Reviews.Author: Duane R. Price
Reviews.Content: I bought a new Nikon camera lens that has a cheap plastic slip-on cover. I wanted one that screws on. It fits well and is well made.

Reviews.Title: Covers More
Reviews.Author: William Kazak
Reviews.Content: I like the new rear lens cap. It covers more of the rear lens mount and that is good. Keeps dirt and scuffs off the lens mount.

Reviews.Title: They just work
Reviews.Author: J. Scaramuzzo
Reviews.Content: Received my cap quickly and it is simple to say that they do the job.  Simple plastic cap that fits all my Nikon lenses so far.

Reviews.Title: It works and it's not outrageously expensive
Reviews.Author: N. Haggin
Reviews.Content: If you have an F-mount lens that didn't come with a bayonet rear cap, like the 50mm f/1.8D Nikkor, get one of these. I did and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Better than my original lens cap!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Designed to fit a Nikon standard F-mount lens, this Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap is fantastic. My lenses originally came with Nikon LF-1 lens caps, which while effective, pale in comparison. Nikon seems to have silently replaced the LF-1 with the new LF-4 and it is a great move. The new cap seems to be more rugged and slightly heavier. The molded plastic has a better grip and finish to it than the older cap, and made it easier to change lenses in cold and wet conditions.Often overlooked for more expensive things like filters and hoods, this cap protects the one of the most critical parts of the lens, and it does it extremely well. I place utmost faith in the new LF-4 Lens Cap, and have bought extra to replace the LF-1 Lens Caps I have on older lenses.

Reviews.Title: I wouldn't say that "I love it", but I give it five stars anyway
Reviews.Author: J Ayers
Reviews.Content: It's hard to say that you love a lens cap.  It's designed to protect the back of the lens.  It fits my Nikon lens, and it protects just like it's supposed to.

Reviews.Title: Fits on my lens
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Nikon rear lens cap.I put it on my Nikon lens.Now my lens is protected.This was a great success.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: akuaten
Reviews.Content: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Capawesome replacement, holds tight, is a tad taller than the original. ive replaced all my old ones as they tend to fall off the lens in transport.

Reviews.Title: I Needed This!
Reviews.Author: DC5-TypeS
Reviews.Content: Its a shame that the D5200 doesn't come with the lens cap from factory but I am certainly glad I have one of these now!

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: pepperdog "aspendog"
Reviews.Content: Now I can keep my lens clean from dust and from being scratched.  The price was good and the time to get it was quicker than I expected.

Reviews.Title: replacement parts
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: Lost my last(original) this was just a replacement. Like to keep all original parts or replacement parts. Never have to many spare parts.

Reviews.Title: Original Nikon rear lens cap
Reviews.Author: Juan UY
Reviews.Content: OK, I don't actually "Love it" as it is just a rear lens cap. It's the original Nikon part.I bought it for the kit lens of my camera as it came with a white plastic one with out threading.

Reviews.Title: A must-have for your lenses
Reviews.Author: Hank C.
Reviews.Content: Does what it says, no problems with it whatsoever. Fits perfectly on my lenses and I keep a couple of extras around just in case.

Reviews.Title: The real deal from Nikon.
Reviews.Author: Paul Wells
Reviews.Content: Is is the real, updated design to catch the rubber seals on newer lens. Nice tight fit. Not much Else to say.

Reviews.Title: Gotta have them
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: It's so easy to lose these guys that you need a couple extra around. They are overpriced for a simple piece of molded plastic.

Reviews.Title: it is nice
Reviews.Author: mohamed
Reviews.Content: the material is good and as described by the manufacture. The item was described clearly and it met my requirment

Reviews.Title: Arear lens cap that works
Reviews.Author: Stewart Jackson
Reviews.Content: Nikon produces are aways the best. The rear lens cap I purchased fit like a glove.  I would purshase it again.

Reviews.Title: Rear lense cap
Reviews.Author: Enos L Stockum
Reviews.Content: will keep the rear of the lens clean an protected when it's not on the camera while in storage when not beining used

Reviews.Title: It's a cap
Reviews.Author: L. Gebhardt
Reviews.Content: Better fit than the older LF1 model. Not much more to say, but I needed to add these extra words for the review to be accepted.

Reviews.Title: Great buy. Just wished Nikon included that with the 50 mm lens.
Reviews.Author: wladen
Reviews.Content: It is the original Nikon one. I wish Nikon included this with its 50 mm instead of a piece of plastic.

Reviews.Title: These are great quality
Reviews.Author: Timothy Coen
Reviews.Content: I switched from Canon to Nikon (don't ask) and (this may sound silly) but the thing I really missed most about my Canon gear was the rear lens cap / camera body cap. They were much better quality than my Nikon ones. This changes that. The LF-1 (which came with all my Nikon lenses) always managed to fall off in my bag, despite snugly securing them. The LF-4 fit much more snug, and I've never had any problems with them slipping off while in my case.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I expected...
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: This lens cap fit my Nikon lenses for my D5100 just perfect.  Came on time and the price was just perfect as compared to going out and buying them at a camera shop locally.

Reviews.Title: I have a prroblem!!!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I keep loosing my caps, so I needed this one for sure, I feel at ease keeping my lens protected.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: Rush Hamden "Filmmaking Teacher"
Reviews.Content: I bought a set of used Nikon lenses, not knowing that none of them came with lens caps or rear lens caps. So I kept them bagged until amazon sent 6 of these rear lens caps. Every one fit perfectly, and they have a high quality plastic feel. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: What else can be said...it's a standard Nikon rear lens cap.
Reviews.Author: Michael K "hawksman"
Reviews.Content: Not much to say except it's a perfect replacement for any Nikon rear lens cap. I really should take away a few stars because Amazon forced me to spend $25 on other items before they would sell me one. But that's not Nikon's fault.

Reviews.Title: Don't need anything more
Reviews.Author: sculpt5 "rb"
Reviews.Content: It fits the indicated size lens and was very inexpensive.  Of course, it came fast and hassle free. I learned my lesson after smoking a couple lenses with my kerosene stove, and ruining a bunch of rolls of film, back in the day. Ever since, I put the caps on, front and  rear.

Reviews.Title: Great product, Amazon order policy not customer friendly
Reviews.Author: Stefan
Reviews.Content: This is a great product, gives much tighter seal than the LF-1, and it easier to put on and get off. I want to convert all my lenses to this cap, however, Amazon won't let me order the 6 caps I need.I can only order 2 because of "limited quantity or low price". Excuse me??? My local camera store had plenty of them and gladly sold me what I wanted for the same price than Amazon.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Ronald G. Carlson
Reviews.Content: not much you can say about a cap other than it fits perfect, does not slip off, and works like it should.

Reviews.Title: Nikon End Cap - works just like it should!
Reviews.Author: Erica IA
Reviews.Content: Perfect replacement for some end-caps I've lost over the years. Fits nicely, good price, no complaints here. I'm sure I'll be back for more!

Reviews.Title: Excellent brand replacement
Reviews.Author: Carter Dale Tuttle
Reviews.Content: These caps replace factory rear lens caps for Nikon and work perfectly.  I like to always have a backup.  Would certainly recommend if you are looking for a replacement rear lens cap.

Reviews.Title: How am I always short one of these?
Reviews.Author: A. Gagas
Reviews.Content: This is just a good thing to have in the bag so you can enjoy guilt-free lens storage on the fly.

Reviews.Title: Factory replacement fits perfict
Reviews.Author: Drunk_Pilot
Reviews.Content: It is what you want to cover the F connector on your Nikor lens. This is not a shabby knock off.

Reviews.Title: The right one !!!
Reviews.Author: ADRStudio
Reviews.Content: It is the replace/spare for the original with a original, nothing more, nothing less. perfect for good price. I need it to replace the one the came with my 18-55 DX, it was a real cheap one.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Kev
Reviews.Content: It's a rear lens cap. Honestly I don't know how much you could write about one, but it works just like a rear lens cap should.

Reviews.Title: They just work well
Reviews.Author: Bob Denhaan
Reviews.Content: On certain lenses the older caps can get finicky about how you line them up.These just pop onto any lens, any brand, in a snap and fit perfect.I have been slowly replacing all my older problem caps with these by adding them on to my amazon orders.Best rear cap I've seen.

Reviews.Title: for good protection
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I need protect $2K lens front and back. Must have it. perfect size and fit right at the back side

Reviews.Title: Protect your rear lens element!
Reviews.Author: T. Mccleary
Reviews.Content: If you don't have a rear lens cover on your expensive Nikon lenses, you should buy this.  Protection of the glass in your lenses is just common sense (which sometimes seems pretty rare).

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Drew Colvin
Reviews.Content: Spending so much on lenses for your camera is tough for anyone. Having these protective caps available to put on those lenses just makes sense. Eliminates scratches and dust. Worth the money anytime, everytime.

Reviews.Title: Product as expected
Reviews.Author: CraigB
Reviews.Content: This is the back lens cap for Nikon lens.  Need to be careful which one you buy, they have the LF-1 and LF-4.  You can check Nikon's site for the correct one and order it here.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: Ramon Palacios
Reviews.Content: Nice new model rear Nikkor lens cap.The changes are subtle but it performs better.Easier grip and better looking.Thank you

Reviews.Title: OEM cap fits perfectly, nicer quality than the cap supplied with low end lenses
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Electronics junkie"
Reviews.Content: Nikon supplies a cheap translucent slip-on cap with the low-end lenses.  Slip-on also means slip-off and that's the last thing you want to happen in your camera bag.

Reviews.Title: Body Caps
Reviews.Author: Jess Newcomb
Reviews.Content: Great to have extra caps around when you are changing lens. These are high quality and fit for F or DX lenses.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: edie obryant
Reviews.Content: It works fine and was just what it said it was .worth the price you pay for it ..I will buy them again

Reviews.Title: Nikon rear lens cap
Reviews.Author: electramic
Reviews.Content: Well. it's a rear lens cap - and it fits.  What more is there to say?Since I am told I need four more words ...  :)

Reviews.Title: Replacement caps
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've bought a couple of these Nikon rear lens caps. One was for a Opteka lens that didn't come with anything and the other is just in case I lose one from any of my lenses. For the price, it's worth having an extra one around for the "just in case".

Reviews.Title: Factory original cap
Reviews.Author: Mark E. Blumer
Reviews.Content: I bought it for a Nikon mount/off brand lens that had a loose rear cap.  This on fits perfectly.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: What could go wrong? Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: Judy M. Judd
Reviews.Content: Nothing went wrong! Arrived promptly, worked perfectly, price okay. Will order again if needed. I have nothing more to add.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for 18 - 55 mm kit lens cap
Reviews.Author: Mtkaat
Reviews.Content: The cap that comes with the Nikon 18 - 55 mm Kit lens is not adequate. This is an excellent replacement and should have been included with the lens as purchased.

Reviews.Title: Factory Nikon
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: If you've ever lost a rear lens cap or bought a used lens from someone with a missing/questionable cap, this is exactly what you need. The low price point puts this OEM cap in the same range as the competitors. I'd buy again no question.

Reviews.Title: It's a lens cap!
Reviews.Author: M. Winchester
Reviews.Content: But, it's great to have a few spares around, so when (not if) I misplace one, I have a ready spare to grab to keep the inside of my lenses protected.

Reviews.Title: Not much to say - works as designed
Reviews.Author: Talvi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a back up in case I lose an end cap for my lenses.  It fits my modern lenses perfectly and I've had no problems with it.  Good sturdy durable plastic that twists on seamlessly.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly
Reviews.Author: deller
Reviews.Content: As an extra cap, it works perfectly when packing or carrying my camera and I don't want any lens mounted to the camera body.

Reviews.Title: Great fit
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Fit great on my Nikon D7000. I like to have a spare cover for each lens/camera I have so this fits that role perfectly.

Reviews.Title: NIKON MULTI LENS FRONT CAP
Reviews.Author: D. DUPLAY "PHOTO-LADY"
Reviews.Content: YOU ALWAYS NEED SOME SPARES OF THIS ITEM.  A VERY GOOD VALUE, GOOD QUALITY, AND FAST SHIPPER. FIT MULTI-LENSES WELL.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: WWCitizen
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I needed since I had lost a previous cap that came with the lens I intended for this cap.

Reviews.Title: perfect, just as it should be
Reviews.Author: KSMD
Reviews.Content: What's there to say? The stock rear lens cap, but way better than the white plastic cup that comes with some of the cheaper lenses. Also attaches to the body cap which can be used to store small items while shooting (hot shoe cover, eyepiece, etc).

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: M. Lewis
Reviews.Content: What can I say.  It's a rear lens cap for Nikon lenses.  Fits snug and secure.  Ordered from Amazon and received 2 original Nikon replacement caps.  Some others have claimed getting knock off caps, but when ordered directly from Amazon I got the real Nikon parts.  This LF-4 (made in Thailand) is a replacement for the LF-1 (made in Japan).  I think that this cap actually fits better than my LF-1 caps with a more secure feel.  I have used it on both modern D/G lenses and older prime manual lenses with no issues either way.  Every Nikon shooter should keep a couple extra of these caps handy.

Reviews.Title: It (naturally) fits my lens
Reviews.Author: DREWSASTER
Reviews.Content: I got one of these OEM with my el-cheapo 55-200 f4.5 zoom, and liked the ability to have lenses off my body and capped. This one worked like a charm for just that, to my knowledge this fits almost every nikkor f mount lens in existence.

Reviews.Title: Fits 50mm D Lens
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My Nikon 50mm D lens didn't come with a nice screw on cap, so I bought this one. Glad I did. It fits perfectly and I feel better having it on there than the pop-on cap (which is now a nice backup cap).

Reviews.Title: replacement
Reviews.Author: Eric Shapiro
Reviews.Content: this was purchased as a replacement cap for my nikkor 18-55mm lens.  this one seems to be a little more snug than the original, but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit and function!
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Boyer
Reviews.Content: I love the way these new lens caps fit--I have now replaced all my old lens caps with these new ones!

Reviews.Title: Amazingly, Nikon actually improved the rear lens cap
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Koblosh
Reviews.Content: The flange on this LF-4 is a few millimeters wider than the traditional rear Nikon lens cap and seals against the back of lenses and Nikon T-mounts securely, yet releases easily.My old lens cap would not lock against my Rokinon 800mm T mount adapter. This cap snugs right up. This is what is now the standard rear lens caps and comes with all new Nikon lenses.

Reviews.Title: Buy these caps skip aftermarket caps.
Reviews.Author: Nikon guy
Reviews.Content: These lens cap's fit properly. They have a nice snug fit which doesn't allow dirt and dust into your lenses. They also don't fall off. I bought this rear cap for the kit lens that came with my D5100. The kit lens only comes with a white cap that just pops on. Well guess what it pops off just as easy. Kinda dumb to put such a cheap cap in the kit. First I bought an aftermarket cap which twisted on but its fit was loose and sloppy. The LF-4 lens cap twists on and fits great. Just twist until its snug that's it. Never try to force a lens or body cap on. This rear cap also comes with all my other Nikon lenses to so its also a great replacement cap just in case I loose one.

Reviews.Title: I nice improvement
Reviews.Author: D. Drufke
Reviews.Content: I think these new Nikon lens caps are a nice improvement over the older design.  They have a much more secure fit, and shouldn't wear out as quickly.  I've ordered enough to replace the caps on all my lenses.

Reviews.Title: exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: Anthony Slatton
Reviews.Content: Quick to ship and items are exactly as advertised. I recommend this product to any photographer that has nikon products

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: J. Steven Barrett "stvbarr"
Reviews.Content: I picked this up to replace the junky soft plastic cap that came with the kit lens.  This bolts right up to my Nikon lenses and has a nice snug fit.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear cap
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I lost my rear lens cap and had to buy a new one.  This Nikon LF-4 rear cap fit exactly as it should.

Reviews.Title: Great Cap
Reviews.Author: jnpiii
Reviews.Content: Great Price, good product. I like this cap a lot. For the money its hard to beat and it provides the protection you need for your lens.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly
Reviews.Author: djallen813
Reviews.Content: After getting my first DSLR camera, I didn't realize I needed to keep the rear lens cap! Ever since then I had been 1 short. Why I didn't buy this sooner, I don't know. It fits perfectly and works just like the original. The LF-4 style fits all my lenses and, as far as I know, fits all Nikon lenses. If you need a replacement, don't wait around just grab this one and you wont be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Good lens cap
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: The Nikon LF-4 lens cap has a good fit, turns smoothly, and, unlike cheaper offerings, will go on the lens in any orientation.  Weirdly enough, I attempted to order several to replace some older/cheaper worn out caps, and my order quantity was capped at one.  It seems an unusual item to have an order cap on, forcing me to have to space them out through several orders.

Reviews.Title: New version caps are great
Reviews.Author: Shivanand Dhannur
Reviews.Content: I bought few of the new version rear caps. They fit really nice on any Nikon mount lenses. When you use the rear cap you can feel that snug fit which was not the case with other rear caps used.

Reviews.Title: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap for the Nikon D5000
Reviews.Author: Larry Arellano
Reviews.Content: Nikon LF-4 Rear Lens Cap fits my D5000 without any problems. This the part that comes with Nikon D5000 Camera. It fits fine and snug, easy to install and remove from camera without any problems. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: It's a rear lens cap!
Reviews.Author: Ryan A
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the same as the Nikon LF-4 I misplaced. I guess I could say that the LF-4 looks and feels better than the LF-1 since I own lenses with both cap types.

Reviews.Title: Fits snugly on lens.
Reviews.Author: Robert Field "leofric1"
Reviews.Content: This makes a nice tight dust-proof seal to the rear end of the lens. There is no danger of it accidentally coming off. Solidly built. Can be attached to the body cap when not in use, and more importantly, easily detached. Much better than the cheap cap that Nikon ships its lenses with. I suppose a cheap cap is fine if you're only ever going to use one lens, but if you're expecting to be changing lens you'll want this.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is nikon.
Reviews.Author: Kyryl
Reviews.Content: Excellent cap. What else to expect from Nikon. Tight sits down on lens. Recommended to everyone who have not nikon lenses.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what it looks like
Reviews.Author: Matthew R. Lilly "Mat Lilly"
Reviews.Content: Nikon replacement rear cap.  Seems exactly like the ones from the factory.  This is a very good item to order a few of.  They aren't expensive, and if you need one it could cost you greatly.  Do not pass this item by.

Reviews.Title: Nice Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: K. Bailey
Reviews.Content: After getting a new lens with one of these protecting the rear lens I started looking for some to upgrade my other Nikon lenses.  The older Nikon lenses, a 50mm f1.2 and some telephoto,  came with white caps that slipped over the end.  They did not fit or seal well and were a bit difficult to get on.  The LFl-4 fit on them was as good as it did on the new lens.  Simple, not much to get excited about, but much better protection.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly
Reviews.Author: dwarf
Reviews.Content: Excellent rear lens cap with works perfectly with all my Nikon Lenses...what more can I say about a lens cap

Reviews.Title: Protects the lens, goes on easy
Reviews.Author: B. Purdy
Reviews.Content: Much better than the Sigma / Tokina lens caps I have lost in the shuffle.  Goes on smoothly, no fidgeting, no wrestling, nada.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Replacement Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: C. Judd
Reviews.Content: It works, it's made of durable plastic, it fits snugly.  This is not complicated engineering but Nikon did it right.

Reviews.Title: A good rear lens cap.
Reviews.Author: Govis
Reviews.Content: It's a rear lens cap.  You don't realize how important your rear lens cap is until you get a 3rd party lens cap that has one particular way that it goes on the back of your lens.  When you're struggling to change lenses, you just want the cap to get on the back of the lens as fast as possible, without having to line things up.  This lens cap accomplishes that and seems to be a very good lens cap. A definite upgrade over my third party lens cap.

Reviews.Title: This Rear Lens Cap is a Keeper
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: Rear Lens cap fits perfectly and goes on and off easily.  Plastic seems sturdy.  I have no complaints.  It's a keeper.

Reviews.Title: It's a lens cap.
Reviews.Author: P. Barnett
Reviews.Content: It has changed my life. As I twisted it into place, I knew I would sleep better every night from now on.I might order a case of them.

Reviews.Title: Design unchanged for decades, needs some long overdue improvements
Reviews.Author: N. Hyland
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon EM as an 11 year old. I sold my Vespa moped (a bad wipe out on a wet street made me loose interest) and used the money to by the EM with a 50 mm. I added zoom lenses over the years and upgraded to an FMII. Basically, this injection molded lens cap has remained the same since the 70s.But, it actually could use some serious rethinking/redesign. Sure, the way it attaches must stay the same (the mounts do not change). But the small mark that tells you how to place it on the lens can be very hard to see. I would rather see it white or yellow and very visible. Just that simple measure would be a big improvement. I am sure an industrial designer could make the grip on it better too (they tend to pop out of hands unexpectedly). Also, for the insanely high price Nikon charges, at the very least, they could spend the extra .01 cents to make the arrow/alignment mark bigger and more visible to help users.Actually, it could be improved for mounting. It could LOCK on the lens so it does not fall off. User presses a small button to remove it from lens.BTW: that FMII was great and worked for years. But after one time on a copy stand, where I spent $200 on film and processing, all the images were blank! I sent it to Nikon and it turns out, the early FMII shutters go BAD. Normally, Nikon would replace it. But they no longer had any. (I wish I had known. I would have sent it in ASAP for replacement 10 years earlier.) In a panic, I bought a refurbed N80 from Nikon. But they would only sell it to me IF they kept the FMII! Ugh, I was desperate. But I wish I had that dead FMII body for nostalgia and because it was such a GREAT camera (except for the bad shutter, which only went into bodies for about a year).

Reviews.Title: Fine
Reviews.Author: C. Vagt
Reviews.Content: It's fine. I actually prefer the older model as it seems to go on a little easier. (I have both) But hey, the price was much better and it does work.

Reviews.Title: LF-1 is better
Reviews.Author: M. Mann
Reviews.Content: Sometimes newer is not better. Though this one is slightly easier to take on and off with the improved grip, the older LF-1 is a sturdier and more precise fit on my lenses.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement cap.  I put it on the lens twisted and NOW IT WILL NOT COME OFF OF A VERY EXPENSIVE LENS.  THE LENS IS A NIKON  AND THIS CAP WAS ADVERTISED TO FIT.  NOW I NEED TO FIND OUT HOW I CAN GET IT REMOVED WITHOUT DAMAGING MY LENS.  DO NOT PURCHASE.  I USUALLY DO NOT WRITE BAD REVIEWS AND ALWAYS TAKE OTHER REVIEWS WITH A GRAIN OF SALT - BUT THIS EXPERIENCE IS HORRENDOUS!

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Derick Vaughan
Reviews.Content: well i had a lens by kiron i thought it would fit but it doesnt.....will save for future use.hope to find some use for it
